pageContext.claim: “When oil crashed, I got Saudi Arabia, Russia, and others to cut nearly 10 million barrels a day, and got OPEC Plus and Mexico to agree to the deal. And hence, we're okay now. We're back.”
pageContext.analysis: Oil prices are still roughly half what they were at the beginning of 2020. Analysts have warned a coronavirus resurgence could add more instability to the market.
